Federal officials seeking to deport Obama's uncle

Immigration officials said today they are pursuing the deportation of Onyango Obama, who was arrested in August on drunken driving charges. (Globe, 2:16 p.m.)
  • Discuss Should Obama's uncle be deported?
  • 3/27/12 Obama's uncle able to avoid jail for DUI charge

Protestors rallying over proposed MBTA fare hikes

A protest has begun at the State House ahead of a vote tomorrow on a plan to close the MBTA's budget gap through fare hikes and service cuts.
  • Pictures What changes to expect from the MBTA
  • 3/29/12 MBTA proposes 23 percent fare increase

BU student-editor resigns over prank

Student newspaper prank stirs uproar at BU
Daily Free Press editor Chelsea Diana resigned and the paper's board apologized following an April Fools' edition that offended people on and off campus. (Globe, 1:14 p.m.)
  • Discuss Your reaction to the paper's editor resigning

Cahill vows to fight corruption charges

Ex-treasurer Timothy Cahill will be arraigned tomorrow on charges he diverted a $1.6 million lottery ad campaign during his run for governor. (Globe, 12:57 p.m.)
  • Discuss  |  Pictures Beacon Hill scandals  |  Video

Boston teachers, city turn to mediator

A last-ditch attempt by school and union leaders to reach agreement on a new teachers' contract failed today, sending the dispute to a state mediator. (Globe, 12:26 p.m.)
  • 4/2/12 Hub schools seek to avert slip when funds run out
  • 4/2/12 Teacher contract impasse costs $9.4m grant
